RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Cincias Biolgicas (2005), mestrado em Cincias Biolgicas (2008) e doutorado em Cincias da Vida e da Sade (2010) pela Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Barcelona (Catalunha, Espanha). Tem atuado na rea da neurobiologia molecular, visando estabelecer pontes entre a neurobiologia da formao de memria e a neurodegenerao, com foco nas bases moleculares da doena de Alzheimer. Bolsista de ps-doutorado jnior (PDJ) do CNPq no Laboratrio de Neurofisiologia e Neuroqumica do Comportamento na Pontificia Universidade Catlica do Rio Grande do Sul em Porto Alegre (2011-2012). Integrante do programa internacional de ps-doutorado FP7-Marie Curie financiado pela Unio Europeia no San Raffaele Scientific Institute em Milo, Itlia (2014-2016).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Cincias Biolgicas from Universidad Pompeu Fabra (2005), master's at Cincias da Vida e da Sade from Universidad Pompeu Fabra (2008) and doctorate at Cincias da Vida e da Sade from Universitat Pompeu Fabra (2010). Has experience in Medicine, focusing on Medicine, acting on the following subjects: alzheimer's disease, amyloid beta-peptide, nitrotyrosination, oxidative stress and triosephosphate isomerase.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
# Position won (11,5 % success rate) at the international call for postdoctoral positions in the San Raffaele Scientific Institution, within the Marie Curie COFUND-INVEST programme of the seventh framework programme of the European Union. (July 2014).
#Certificao de Proficincia em Lngua Portuguesa para Estrangeiros, no nvel AVANADO SUPERIOR--CELPE-BRAS. (Janeiro de 2014).
# Certificate for Research and Teaching conceded by the Catalan Agency for the Quality of the university system --AQU. (July, 2015).
# RESEARCH AT FOREIGNER INSTITUTIONS
- February 2010. Research stage at the Laboratory for the Research of Neurodegenerative Diseases, VIB, Department of Molecular and Developmental Genetics, K.U.Leuven, Belgium. http://med.kuleuven.be/cme-mg/lncb/index.html Title of the project: ?Nitric oxide induces BACE1 translation by Heme-regulated eukaryotic initiation factor(eIF)2alpha kinase(HRI)-mediated eIF2alpha phosphorylation?
- March and April 2009. Research stage in the Neurovirology Group of the University of Manchester. Manchester, England, United Kingdom. http://www.ls.manchester.ac.uk/research/researchgroups/neurosciences/people/index.aspx?PersonID=872&view=research Title of the project: ?Effect of HSV-1 in the up-regulation of BACE1?.
- January to July, 2005. Student in formation in the Molecular Pathology Department. Molekulare Pathologie Abteilung. Universitt Wrzburg, Germany. Training in molecular cloning
- June and August, 2002. Assistant in the Emergencies Department, Hospital de Nuevo Len, Universidad Federal de Nuevo Leon, Monterrey, Mxico.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo do papel protector do xido ntrico no processamento proteolitico da proteina precursora do amiloide (APP) e o dano nitrativo relacionado com a doena de Alzheimer
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The present project addresses the study of the role of nitric oxide (NO) in the etiopathology of Alzheimer?s disease (AD). NO is produced by neurons during the memory process in the hippocampus, being this area one of the fist brain part damaged by senile plaques of amyloid -peptide (A). According to previous experiments performed by our group, we propose study the role of NO in the cleavage of amyloid precursor protein (APP) by the specific secretases. We predict an increase in the BACE1 expression which would induce an increased synaptic plasticity but with the time, it would yield to an accumulation of A. A aggregated is a source of superoxide anion, which reacts with NO to produce peroxynitrite (ONOO-). ONOO- is highly reactive anion, which binds nitro groups to tyrosine inducing the decrease or even completely avoiding the biological activity of the proteins. Then, we will study the effect of nitrative stress on NMDA and AMPA receptors, both directly implied in memory processes. Moreover, we will study the NO synthases activated by these recepors and the effect of nitrative stress on the glutamate production by the presinaptic terminal.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The present project addresses the study of the role of nitric oxide (NO) in the etiopathology of Alzheimer?s disease (AD). NO is produced by neurons during the memory process in the hippocampus, being this area one of the fist brain part damaged by senile plaques of amyloid -peptide (A). According to previous experiments performed by our group, we propose study the role of NO in the cleavage of amyloid precursor protein (APP) by the specific secretases. We predict an increase in the BACE1 expression which would induce an increased synaptic plasticity but with the time, it would yield to an accumulation of A. A aggregated is a source of superoxide anion, which reacts with NO to produce peroxynitrite (ONOO-). ONOO- is highly reactive anion, which binds nitro groups to tyrosine inducing the decrease or even completely avoiding the biological activity of the proteins. Then, we will study the effect of nitrative stress on NMDA and AMPA receptors, both directly implied in memory processes. Moreover, we will study the NO synthases activated by these recepors and the effect of nitrative stress on the glutamate production by the presinaptic terminal.
